hwesta is a noun meaning "breeze" in Que: Image:Hwesta.gifHwesta is also the name in Quenya of the twelfth letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  It is the fourth letter of the third grade or Tyellë
Note: which contains "voiceless spirants" and it is the third letter in the fourth series of consonants.  For written Quenya or Sindarin
The names of the letters: the fourth series is used for the labialized or kw-series

Note: which does not need a distinct sign for chw
The names of the letters: this letter represents HW.  In Sindarin
column4: which does distinguish between chw and hw
column5: Hwesta represents CHW while Hwesta Sindarinwa (the thirty-fourth letter) represents HW.  In Westron the fourth series is used for the k-series
column7: and this letter represents spirant CH as in Scottish "loch".  The Westron name for this letter is AhaSee Westron Tengwar (not to be confused with the name in Quenya of Aha).
